title: Nikki Bella shines in busty purple velvet and satin pantsuit at the Girl Up #GirlHero Awards
text:
She's taken the wrestling world by storm, and recently empowered herself to discuss her sex life with dancer boyfriend Artem Chigvintsev.

Nikki Bella was a sight to behold on Sunday, when she attended the 2nd Annual Girl Up #GirlHero Awards at the Beverly Wilshire Four Seasons Hotel in Beverly Hills, California.

The brunette beauty, 35, wore a fabulous wine-colored ensemble that included a plunging crushed velvet blazer with satin lapels, and matching satin slacks.

Violet vision: Nikki Bella was a sight to behold on Sunday, when she attended the 2nd Annual Girl Up #GirlHero Awards at the Beverly Wilshire Four Seasons Hotel in Beverly Hills

Bella's jacket was closed with a single button, and underneath she wore an equally low-cut beige corset.

Her stick straight jet black hair was down, and over one shoulder.

Nikki chose not to add jewelry to the look, and kept it simple with pointy black pumps on her feet.

Her makeup featured a strong, bold red lip.

A bold look: The brunette beauty wore a fabulous wine-colored ensemble that included a plunging crushed velvet blazer with satin lapels

Coordinated: She donned matching satin slacks

Bella, who was a contestant on Dancing With The Stars in 2017, also took time to pose with current contestant Hannah Brown, of The Bachelorette fame.

Once inside the venue, Bella had the honor of presenting a Girl Hero Award to event honoree Chanice Lee.

The Girl Up #GirlHero Awards is an event celebrating gender equality and female changemakers.

Dancing ladies: Bella, who was a contestant on Dancing With The Stars in 2017, also took time to pose with current contestant Hannah Brown, of The Bachelorette fame

This year’s luncheon, held in recognition of International Day of the Girl, was emceed by Julianne Hough and is honoring Cara Delevingne, Kate Hudson, Jameela Jamil and specific Girl Up girl changemakers.

According to its website, Girl Up is 'a global movement of empowered young women leaders who defend gender equality' utilizing leadership development training.

The organization was founded by the United Nations Foundation in 2010.

Setting an example: The Girl Up #GirlHero Awards is an event celebrating gender equality and female changemakers
description: She's taken the wrestling world by storm, and recently empowered herself to discuss her sex life with dancer boyfriend Artem Chigvintsev.
